item.title: Free as in freedom, not free beer.
item.description: The phrase “free as in freedom not free beer” is often used to explain the difference between two meanings of the word “free” in the context of software.

item.title: VisiCalc
item.description: The world’s first spreadsheet software Debuted on Apple II Made by Dan Bricklin and Bob Frankston From [[Triumph of the Nerds]]

item.title: Computer
item.description: Computer 5 (geddit? because 5 in binary is 101. No? It wasn’t funny?…) What is a computer? It’s an electronic device

item.title: Digital Tracking
item.description: Most sites, almost all of the free ones turn a profit by selling you. By selling your data. The Internet runs on data and ads.

item.title: Clay Shirky
item.description: Clay Shirky (born 1964) is an American writer, consultant and teacher on the social and economic effects of Internet technologies and journalism.

item.title: Pareto principle
item.description: 80/20 rule or rule of vital few says that roughly 80% of consequences come from 20% of causes in Economics -

item.title: Components of IAM
item.description: What is IAM? Identity Access Management to control access of individual and group access a combination of policies identifying people and allocating resources

item.title: Digital Signature
item.description: A cryptographic output used to verify the authenticity of data two operations : Signing Operation - uses a signing key to produce a signature over raw data Verification Operation - signature can be validated by a party who has no knowledge of the signing key Workflow two participants

item.title: Identity Access Management and Components of IAM
item.description: What is IAM? Identity Access Management to control access of individual and group access a combination of policies identifying people and allocating resources
